website_summaries.verdict: The Acer T232HL is the first Windows 8–certified touch-screen monitor to hit the labs, and it's a winner.
pros: Great color and viewing angle performance

customer_reviews.title: Years later review
customer_reviews.text: Writing this review after numerous years of having the product - which I am now gifting to someone else. Never had any issues. The touch screen is decent, but don’t expect it to act like a graphics table, more like a smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: RiverStyx

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for roughly 2 weeks now. It's brilliant - very modern design, touch works a treat and image quality is superb (you might need to configure it for your taste). The usb ports come in quite handy! I wouldn't rely on the sound from it as it's no better than any TV built in speakers. Other than that, no concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Ale Sra

customer_reviews.title: First class monitor
customer_reviews.text: Had been looking for a touch screen monitor since upgrading my PC to windows 8 in December 2012. Had been keeping an eye on this one for a few months before deciding to take the plunge. Easy set up and is easy to use. Looks great! Excellent item! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ayhan Dursun

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant upgrade for PC
customer_reviews.text: The first monitor had a fault with the touch but Amazon replaced it quickly and easily. It's a really nice monitor and the touch works really well, I hardly use the keyboard anymore. The monitor position is really easy to adjust to lie flatter for typing etc. Although the Pentium 4 it's attached to us starting to show its age!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: ... expert but I think the image on this is fantastic and I would highly recommend this monitor
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a technical expert but I think the image on this is fantastic and I would highly recommend this monitor. Be aware that you need to use both an HDMI and a USB cable to get the touch-screen functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Schnook

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor, very responsive touch
customer_reviews.text: Excellent monitor, very responsive touch, and crystal clear graphics, make sure you connect the USB lead supplied to get the touch functions, and to use the extra usb 3s you need another lead.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Monitor.

customer_reviews.title: Acer T232hl 23 inch monitor
customer_reviews.text: the Acer monitor is great and easy to get going, would recommend it no problem, can be adapted to any position it is the first I have seen to be win.8 approved
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Acer Warranty 10p a minute and you will need to call them
customer_reviews.text: Had two of these now and both had dust or some foreign matter under the screen, VERY annoying especially when you know its there. Inspect carefully before you even turn the monitor on and i guarantee you will find the same. As a monitor though its not bad, i use keyboard, mouse and touch - buy plenty of screen wipes though!! will try for another replacement but i fear the manufacturing process (cheap) will mean the same problem. Acer take note, your warranty process is the worst i've ever had the misfortune to have use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Millam

customer_reviews.title: acer touches itself - usless screen going back to non touch
customer_reviews.text: have been using this for a few months. Now going back to non touch. This one has a fault so it "touches itself" which makes the mouse go crazy all the time. unworkable
customer_reviews.author: 1stedition

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the image and responsiveness
customer_reviews.text: The stand is a bit odd and stiff, but very manageable. Despite its appearance on the images, screen can be put in position that is quite usable when standing. Using a touchscreen is, in general, surprisingly enjoyable. It's disappointing that OS X does not work nicely with this monitor's touch; this is OS X's fault, though, as it believes it's dealing with a single-contact-point graphics tablet. While watching videos, I noticed that occasionally the backlight does oddly dim. It might be my eyes playing tricks with me, but I somehow doubt it. Still, I really love the screen overall.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Vucica

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say other than a really excellent monitor. Son is delighted. Stand is rock solid but does need a fair amount of pressure to lock it down. The worry is you will break it but unlikely given the build. Once it is locked down you simply tip the screen into position. Colours and response times first rate. Touch screen elements fast and responsive. Good Acer quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: NobbyA

customer_reviews.title: Great Windows 8 Screen
customer_reviews.text: Good size and well made. 3 USB3 connectors. Sharp and responsive. I bought it to really try the windows 8 experience, you will either love Win8 or hate it, I hated it then started to get used to it, now like it. Using this monitor has made windows 8 better although I still use keyboard and mouse. I haven't connected the internal speakers as this would be a downgrade to the external system I use. But I would recommend it whole heartedly.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this monitor I researched as much as possible to make sure I was buying a good valued touch screen monitor. Before I posted this I have used this monitor every day for at least 8 hours a day and at moment finger cross I have no trouble at all. Very sharp, precise with the touch function it does exactly what it suppose to do and is doing it well. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Open Source Channel UK

customer_reviews.title: Great for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought the screen to be used in a sound stage specifically made for producing audio books. After one day, I've improved my effectivity with 5% (probably mainly because the software I use has been made with touch screen in mind, but then again, you need a good product to support the software). Almost no sound when touching screen will make it a perfect companion for many years to come in my sound studio. I am also very happy that the price on Amazon has fallen to an affordable level.
customer_reviews.author: Kruse

customer_reviews.title: Does what I want.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good looking piece of kit and works well as a touch screen. Not sure what else to say other than it ticks all the boxes for me as a multi-touch monitor of a decent size at a reasonable price. The USB hub on the side is quite useful too although it only has three slots.
